result.title: AI boom seen lifting chipmaking equipment sales 9% to $126 billion in 2026
result.text: Sales of equipment used to make computer chip wafers will rise about 9% to $126 billion in 2026 and a further 7.3% to $135 billion in 2027, as chipmakers expand capacity for logic and memory chips used in artificial intelligence, industry group SEMI forecast on Tuesday.

result.title: KLA: A Buy With Caution At Current Levels
result.text: KLA Corporation (KLAC) remains a core semiconductor holding, benefiting from AI-driven demand and its near-monopoly in process control equipment. KLAC is well-positioned for growth as advanced chip complexity and global capex surge, but current valuations are stretched, warranting a 'buy with caution' stance. Risks include high China exposure, customer concentration, and premium multiples, but long-term prospects remain strong due to industry barriers and onshoring trends.
